newsitem.title: USA: Energy sees H2 97 revs similar to H1.
newsitem.headline: Energy sees H2 97 revs similar to H1.

text.p: Energy Research Corp said Friday it expects revenues for the second half of the year will be similar to the $11.8 million it reported in the first half.
The company reported revenues of $14.8 million in the first six months of 1996.
The company, which holds a number of contracts with the U.S. Department of Energy, reported second quarter revenues of $6.1 million against $7.8 million for the same period in 1996.
It blamed the lower revenues mostly on the end of a contract at a Direct Fuel Cell power plant project in Santa Clara, California.
Earnings for the second quarter were $0.02 a share against $0.03 a year ago.
Energy Research conducts research and development for the manufacture of fuel cells and batteries used in the industrial and electric utility sectors.
